extendedIngredients.name: bread
extendedIngredients.original: 8 (1/2-inch-thick) bread slices from a round country loaf
extendedIngredients.originalName: (1/2-inch-thick) bread slices from a round country

extendedIngredients.name: goat cheese
extendedIngredients.original: 6 ounces soft mild goat cheese, softened

extendedIngredients.name: red onion

title: Warm Goat Cheese, Beet and Arugula Sandwiches
summary: Warm Goat Cheese, Beet and Arugula Sandwiches might be just the main course you are searching for. Watching your figure? This vegetarian recipe has 3952 calories, 150g of protein, and 66g of fat per serving. This recipe serves 4. For $6.9 per serving, this recipe covers 72% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. 1 person found this recipe to be yummy and satisfying. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 20 minutes. Head to the store and pick up arugula leaves, beets, dijon mustard, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the balsamic vinegar you could follow this main course with the Skinny Strawberry Ice Cream as a dessert. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 87%. This score is outstanding. Try Beet Carpaccio with Goat Cheese and Arugula, beet and goat cheese arugula salad, and Beet & Goat Cheese Arugula Salad for similar recipes.
instructions: Preparation                                                        Preheat broiler.                                                                Whisk together vinegar, mustard, and salt and pepper to taste, then whisk in 2 tablespoons oil. Toss beets with vinaigrette.                                                                Arrange bread on a large baking sheet and brush tops with remaining tablespoon oil. Season with salt and pepper and broil 6 inches from heat 1 to 1 1/2 minutes, or until edges are golden. Remove 4 slices from oven. Turn remaining 4 slices over on baking sheet and spread thickly with goat cheese. Broil 1 minute more and transfer to plates. Top goat cheese with drained beets, onion, arugula, and remaining bread, toasted sides up.

steps.step: Whisk together vinegar, mustard, and salt and pepper to taste, then whisk in 2 tablespoons oil. Toss beets with vinaigrette.
Arrange bread on a large baking sheet and brush tops with remaining tablespoon oil. Season with salt and pepper and broil 6 inches from heat 1 to 1 1/2 minutes, or until edges are golden.

Remove 4 slices from oven. Turn remaining 4 slices over on baking sheet and spread thickly with goat cheese. Broil 1 minute more and transfer to plates. Top goat cheese with drained beets, onion, arugula, and remaining bread, toasted sides up.
